titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the George Mason University Athletic Department records
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections and Archives R0002

archdesc.runner: Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Special Collections and Archives.

did.unittitle: George Mason University Athletic Department records
did.abstract: Collection contains information relating to George Mason University athletic programs.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: George Mason University Athletic Department records, Collection #R0002, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated by the George Mason University Athletic Department.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Special Collections and Archives staff.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: George Mason University has approximately 250 student-athletes compete in 20 men's and women's Division I sports-baseball, basketball, cross country, diving, golf, lacrosse, rowing, soccer, softball, swimming, tennis, indoor and outdoor track and field, volleyball, and wrestling. Intercollegiate men's and women's teams are members of the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) Division I, the Colonial Athletic Association (CAA), the Eastern College Athletic Conference (ECAC), and the Intercollegiate Association of Amateur Athletes of America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection contains information relating to George Mason University athletic programs. The collection also contains news articles, tickets, fliers, and other memorabilia from the 2006 NCAA Men's Basketball Tournament.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections and Archives holds the George Mason University records.

did.unittitle: 2006 NCAA Men's Basketball Tickets March 24 - April 3, 2006

scopecontent.p: Tickets for the NCAA Sweet Sixteen, Elite Eight, Final Four, and Championship games of the tournament . Also included is a ticket pack cover and an admission ticket to Hoop City.

Limited-edition color embossed envelope bearing a cancellation stamp of the Mason Patriots logo. The envelope, stamped at Fairfax Station, VA on April 7, 2006 was part of the citywide celebration for the Patriots' tournament run.

did.unittitle: George Mason University Day Proclamation: County of Fairfax, VA March 24, 2006

scopecontent.p: Proclamation by the Fairfax County Board of Supervisors designating Friday, March 24, 2006 as George Mason University Day. Document contains the signature of Gerald E. Connolly, Chairman of the Fairfax County Board of Supervisors and is dated March 24, 2006.

did.unittitle: Certificate of Recognition, County of Fairfax, May 15, 2006 May 15, 2006

scopecontent.p: Certificate of Recognition presented to the George Mason University Men's Basketball Team by the County of Fairfax. Document contains the signature of Gerald E. Connolly, Chairman of the Fairfax County Board of Supervisors and is dated May 15, 2006.

The souvenirs included in this box are: NCAA Final Four ticket holders with lanyards (2), Coach Larranaga music box, George Mason "We Believe" cup, "Go Mason!" buttons (2), Mason Patriots 2006 Final Four badge and lanyard, Mason Patriots temporary tattoos (3), "Larranaga Special" whistles (3), green and yellow pom-pom, and "Go Mason!" thundersticks (2)

did.unittitle: NCAA 2006 Tournament T-Shirts and Small Mason Patriots Posters 2005-2006

scopecontent.p: T-Shirts: Sweet Sixteen, Elite Eight, 2 different Final Four shirts. Posters: School of Management "Heart" Patriots, Mason Madness (2), and Go Mason (3)

did.unittitle: 2005-06 Men's Basketball Season and Tournament Run oversize materials 2005-06

scopecontent.p: Oversized materials related to the 2005-06 basketball season: Washington Post printing plate from March 27, 2006, Fairfax commuter bus "Go Patriots" sign, community signed bus banners (3), and large Mason Patriots posters (5)
